articles.content:
Committee for Supporting Korean People's Anti-U.S. Struggle formed in Syria 
    Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A committee for Supporting the Anti-U.S. Struggle of the Korean People was formed in Syria on Jan. 11.
 An inaugural statement expressed full support to the struggle of the fraternal Korean people wisely led by Kim Jong Il as regards the serious situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula owing to the U.S. imperialists' vicious moves to invade the DPRK.    
 The statement declared that the committee with Riyad Suleiman Awad, director of the information department of the Socialist Unionist Party of Syria, as its chairman was formed to explain the stand of Korea to people and make them express solidarity with the Korean people.

articles.content:
Anecdote about Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Early in September Juche 91 (2002)  Kim Jong Il met some officials and discussed issues concerning economic construction and people's living.
 The officials hoped that he would take some rest because he worked all night for days.    
 But he told them that he had become accustomed to working all night and he would take a full rest when Korea joins the ranks of the most developed countries in the world and the people are well off. He then said the day would surely come and victory always belongs to the Korean people.

Special envoy of south side here
    Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Rim Tong Won, special aide of Chongwadae on diplomacy, security and unification who is special envoy of President Kim Dae Jung, and his party arrived here today to visit Pyongyang, at the request of the south side.
 They were greeted at the airport by Rim Tong Ok, first vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned.    
 A woman worker presented the special envoy with a bouquet.
